title: Button
description: A versatile button component that can be used in different styles and sizes.

import.description: This code shows how to import the Button component from your library.

examples.title: Default
Sizes
Radius
Colors
Variants

propsTable.title: Button Props
propsTable.description: List of all props supported by the Button component.

rows.description: Content to be displayed inside the button.
Aria label for accessibility. Provides additional context for screen readers.
Defines the color of the button. Options are: 'primary', 'secondary', 'success', 'warning', 'danger'.
Callback function triggered when the button is clicked.
Inline styles to be applied to the button.
Defines the size of the button. Options are: 'sm', 'md', 'lg'.
Defines the border-radius of the button. Options are: 'none', 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'full'.
Defines the border width of the button. Options are: 'none', 'xs', 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'xl'.
Additional CSS class names to apply to the button.

eventsTable.title: Events
eventsTable.description: List of all events emitted by the Button component.

rows.type: Triggered when the button is clicked.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Accessibility considerations for the Button component.

ariaRoles.description: The Button component is rendered with the button role by default.
If the button has only an icon and no text, you should add an aria-label for screen readers.
